page.title: 02TOURISM IN LLANGYNIDR
page.content: THE MAIN ATTRACTION OF LLANGYNIDR IS THE CANAL. THIS RUNS FROM BRECON TO MONMOUTH AND NEWPORT AND HAS THE LONGEST WORKING CANAL TUNNEL IN BRITAIN. TOURISTS COME TO THE VILLAGE ON BARGES AND STOP TO SEE THE PRETTY COUNTRYSIDE. THE RIVER USK RUNS THROUGH THE VILLAGE. IT IS CROSSED BY A VERY ATTRACTIVE NARROW BRIDGE WHICH HAS SIX ARCHES AND AN UNUSUAL SHAPE. TOURISM HAS A SIGNIFICANT EFFECT ON THE VILLAGE SHOP. WITHOUT IT A SMALL BUSINESS WOULD BE STRUGGLING TO SURVIVE. TOURISTS STAY FOR BED AND BREAKFAST AT LLANDETTY HALL FARM, WHICH IS 380 YEARS OLD.THE PRESENT TENNANTS HAVE BEEN LIVING AT THE FARM FOR 20 YEARS AND THEY HAVE BEEN TAKING BED AND BREAKFAST FOR 13 YEARS. THE VISITORS COME FROM ALL OVER BRITAIN, EUROPE AND AS FAR AS AMERICA.THE BLACK MOUNTAINS SURROUND LLANGYNIDR.
